column2: VIRGINIA DMV TEST
column4: Virginia

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: One Way
column8: Right lane closed

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycle repair shop ahead
column8: No Bicycle zone

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: A road joins from the left
column8: Sharp right turn
column10: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left

column2: 4. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column4: Turn off the ignition.
column8: Slow down.

column2: 5. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must turn around immediately.
column6: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.
column8: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column10: they must not drive past this sign.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead
column8: Sharp curve ahead

column2: 7. The posted speed limit shows:
column4: the maximum safe speed under all road conditions.
column6: the speed at which you must travel to effectively deal with tailgaters.
column8: the maximum safe speed under ideal road and weather conditions.

column2: 8. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.
column8: go to work.

column2: 9. The sign in the picture:
column4: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column10: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column6: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.
column8: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
column10: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.

column2: 11. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
column6: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column8: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column10: accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.

column2: 12. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the right.
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column8: use the road edge as a guide until the approaching vehicle passes by.

column2: 13. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
column4: go the wrong way.
column8: exceed the speed limit

column2: 14. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Keep your vehicle in good condition.
column6: Do not drive if you are very weary.
column8: Maintain the correct speed.

column2: 15. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 16. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Drive with caution.
column6: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column8: Stop, yield the right-of-way, and go.
column10: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.

column2: 17. Aggressive drivers:
column4: are high risk drivers.
column8: tailgate other vehicles and make improper lane changes.

column2: 18. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: How fit you are. How much alcohol you drink. Your height.
column6: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column8: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column10: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.

column2: 19. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.

column2: 20. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: No.
column6: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column8: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.

column2: 21. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column6: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column8: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 22. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
column4: are less important than
column8: never take precedence over

column2: 23. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column6: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column8: make alcohol the focus of the event.
column10: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.

column2: 24. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column6: turn left into the one-way road.
column8: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column10: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.

column2: 25. When approaching road construction areas, drivers should:
column4: keep their vehicles in the middle of the lane and obey the speed limit.
column8: be alert to flashing arrow panels, signs and flaggers.

column2: 26. A professional truck driver must:
column4: have a professional forklift operator license.
column6: have a valid truck mechanic license.
column8: have a valid commercial driver's license.

column2: 27. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must do it.
column6: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column8: you must call the police.
column10: you must wait for the red light to turn green.

column2: 28. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: keep one hand on the steering wheel.
column8: avoid scanning the road ahead.
column10: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.

column2: 29. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column4: emergency flashers.
column8: low beam headlights.

column2: 30. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column4: Pumping brakes.
column8: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.

column2: 31. To obtain your driver's license, you must pass a _______ test.
column4: vision.
column8: knowledge.

column2: 32. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: enter the intersection and then stop.
column8: come to a complete stop.
column10: slow down and enter the intersection.

column2: 33. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column6: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
column8: The driver can legally pass red lights.

column2: 34. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If aÂ car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
column6: wait for the next green light.
column8: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column10: enter the intersection and then stop.

column2: 35. You are considered to be driving under the influence (DUI) if your blood alcohol content (BAC) is ______ or higher.
column4: .10 percent
column8: .5 percent

column2: 36. It is illegal to transport children under age 16 in the bed of a pickup truck, even if equipped with a camper shell.
column4: False

column2: 37. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column6: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.
column8: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
column10: Try to fight the fire yourself.

column2: 38. Your driving privilege may be suspended or revokedÂ if you are convicted of:
column4: reckless or aggressive driving.
column8: operating a vehicle without a valid license.
column10: All the other answers are correct.

column2: 39. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column6: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column8: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.

column2: 40. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
column4: must not yield to
column8: can handle
